subject: Re: Soundcard works for one account but not others
body:
On Sun, Apr 15, 2007 at 16:01:29 +0200, Franklin PIAT wrote:
> On Sat, 2007-04-14 at 12:09 +0400, sm00th_trac3r wrote:
> > On Sat, Apr 14, 2007 at 08:49:47AM +0100, Colin Cotter wrote:
> > > Dear List,
> > >  I have an odd problem with sound on my laptop. It works for my
> > > account, but not that of my wife (bad for Linux advocacy :-[ ). For
> > > example, her volume control has a red cross on it and says that
> > > 
> > > Does anybody have any suggestions on how to fix this?
> > Try adding your wife's account to "audio" group.
> 
> BTW, The first account created during debian installation is
> automatically granted certains "privileges" (i.e added to groups).
> 
> So there are other groups that could be useful to your wife..
> Under gnome menu Desktop/Administration/Users and Groups.
> Select your account, click on properties, then "User Privileges" tab.
> 
> Then compare your profile and your wife's one.

Group membership for new users can be automated using the EXTRA_GROUPS
and ADD_EXTRA_GROUPS options in /etc/adduser.conf. The comments in this
file explain the details.

-- 
Regards,
          Florian
